tasks.task: Embark on a mowing session in a field
subtasks: Position oneself at the start of the field
Stand or walk towards the mowing area
Latch the mower to a tractor or implement
Observe the area to be mowed for any obstructions
Operate the power take-off (PTO) to engage the mower
Adjust the mower blades to the appropriate height
Check fuel and oil levels before starting the mower
Start the mower engine and perform a safety check
Engage the PTO and begin mowing the crops
Monitor blade operation and make adjustements as needed
Stop the mower at appropriate intervals to recalibrate
Disengage the PTO and shut down the mower engine
Remove the mower from the tractor and store

tasks.task: Replant seedlings in a nursery
subtasks: Prepare the soil plot by loosening and breaking it
Sort through seedlings for any damaged or unwanted ones
Dig holes at the specified spacing for the seedlings
Insert each seedling into a hole, ensuring proper depth
Backfill the soil around the seedling and tamp it down
Water the planted seedlings to settle the soil
标记行间距和顺序 for future reference

tasks.task: Attach a gooseneck ballast tank to a semi-trailer
subtasks: Identify the correct gooseneck attachment point on the semi
Position the ballast tank near the semi-trailer
Align the gooseneck coupling with the semi's hitch
Connect the ballast tank to the semi using the gooseneck system
Secure the tank with locks or chains to prevent jostling
Adjust the height and angle of the ballast tank for stability
Check that all connections are tight and secure
Verify the brakes and release mechanisms on the ballast tank
Ensure proper weight distribution between the semi and the tank

tasks.task: Conduct a planting operation with a precision seeder
subtasks: Select the correct discs and toolbar for the crop type
Assemble the precision seeder according to the planter's specifications
Couple the seeder to the toolbar or planter frame
Calibrate the seeder by setting the appropriate seed depth and placement pattern
Ensure proper seed and fertilizer placement by adjusting the openers and plates
Check the depth gauge wheels for accurate seed coverage
Install seed boxes and load them with the appropriate seeds
Attach tension chains and calibrate for even seed flow
Prime the seeder by operating it on a flat surface
Adjust seed speed and delivery rate as needed based on conditions
Monitor the planting width and make adjustments to the planter sweeps
Clean the seeder components after each use and store properly

tasks.task: Apply fertilizer to rows using a side-dresser
subtasks: Position the side-dresser appropriately between crop rows
Align fertilizer tubes or applicator wheels with the correct rows
Adjust the side-dresser's height to the appropriate soil depth
Check the flow rate of the fertilizer dispenser
Activate the side-dresser and begin applying fertilizer along the rows
Ensure accurate application by maintaining a steady speed
Monitor overlaps and gaps to avoid over-fertilization or deficiency
Disengage the side-dresser when done and cover applicator arms
Check the applicator components for damage or clogs after use
Clean and lubricate the applicator as needed before storage

tasks.task: Apply pesticide using a boom sprayer
subtasks: Select the appropriate nozzles and agitation types for the pesticide
Fill the sprayer tank with the correct pesticide mixture
Connect the sprayer to the pesticide container and agitator
Position the sprayer boom over the crop rows, ensuring proper overlap
Set the pressure and flow rate according to the pesticide label
Calibrate the sprayer for coverage, ensuring even distribution
Operate the sprayer while moving through the rows, monitoring coverage
Adjust as necessary to compensate for drift or uneven terrain
Stop the sprayer when completing a section, allowing chemicals to settle
Clean the sprayer booms and tank after use to prevent residue buildup

tasks.task: Cite maintenance tasks on a sprayer unit
subtasks: Check spray nozzles for blockages or wear, replacing as needed
Inspect the boom for tears, cracks, or leaks; repair or replace components
Verify the agitator and pump function to ensure proper pesticide mix
Clean the sprayer's tank, hoses, and boom to remove residues
Lubricate moving parts such as connectors and boom hinges
Inspect safety features like pressure relief valves and alarms
Test electrical components such as lights and switches
Calibrate the sprayer's indicators for accurate chemical measurement

tasks.task: Secure a harvest container on a combine harvester
subtasks: Choose the appropriate container for the grain being harvested
Place the container on the platform of the combine harvester
Fasten the container cover or tarp securely to prevent loss
Engage the grain delivery system to test if the grain is flowing properly
Monitor the container's fill level and adjust speed if necessary
Adjust the headers to clean the grain and remove any debris
Connect the vacuum system or sack filling mechanism
Disengage and replace the container when full, recording the weight
Rinse the container between different grain types to avoid contamination

tasks.task: Operate a sidedress applicator for fertilizer application
subtasks: Align the applicator's coulter blades or knives with the field rows
Adjust the opener depth to the desired soil penetration
Commence application, ensuring the fertilizer is placed at the correct depth
Monitor application efficiency and adjust as needed
Check for clumping or bridging in the fertilizer hoppers
Address any maintenance needs during application, such as seal checks
Clean and lubricate the applicator after use
Store the applicator配件 properly

tasks.task: Confiscate the ballast from a stockpile using a loader
subtasks: Secure the excavator or loader bucket onto a suitable piece of equipment
Approach the ballast stockpile, positioning the bucket under the pile
Scoop the ballast from the stockpile, stacking it into the bucket
Transfer the loaded bucket to a designated area, such as a mixing plant
Repeat the scooping and moving process until the task is complete
Unload the bucket and level the ballast pile for efficiency

tasks.task: Perform routine maintenance on a combine harvester
subtasks: Inspect the header rolls and adjust for proper grain contact
Check the condition of the cutters and tines for damage
Verify that the silage auger is aligned and secure
Test the hydraulic systems for leaks and proper operation
Inspect the vacuum conveyor for any obstructions or leaks
Examine the grain tank and its components for integrity
Check the auxiliary power take-off (PTO) for engagement and disengagement
Adjust the belt tension on the transmission as needed
Service the engine oil, filters, and air cleaner

tasks.task: Place bales on a livestock platform
subtasks: Gather bales from the storage area and transport them to the platform
Either carry the bales manually or use a loader to lift them
Place the bales onto the platform, ensuring stability
Arrange the bales in the desired configuration on the platform
Secure the bales with ties or pins to prevent movement during transport
Secure the bales on the platform using a net or cover to prevent falling during transit

tasks.task: Install a bale chewer mechanism on a combine
subtasks: Identify the correct position for the bale chewer relative to the combine
Lift or move the bale chopper mechanism into place on the combine
Secure the chopper blades to the header in the proper orientation
Calibrate the closing mechanism to ensure the chopper cuts the bales effectively
Test the chopper by operating the combine on a suitable bale type
Check for any clogs or jams in the system and address them
Attach safety barriers or guards as required for operator protection

tasks.task: Adjust a disk hill maker to create beds for planting
subtasks: Ensure the disk hill maker is properly hitched to the tractor
Align the disks with the intended planting rows
Adjust the disk depth to the optimal level for soil preparation
Set the horizontal angle of the disks for hill configuration
Test the operation of the hill maker on a section of ground
Fine-tune the spacing between hills to maximize crop efficiency
Verify the continuity of the hill lines for even planting placement

tasks.task: Calibrate a planter's depth gauge wheels
subtasks: Access the depth gauge wheel sets on the planter
Use a ruler or gauge to measure the distance between the wheel and the seed furrow
Adjust the position of the wheel to meet the required ideal depth
Confirm that the gauge wheels are perpendicular to the ground
Test the adjusted depth by recording the furrow depth with a measuring tape
Mark the new setting for future adjustments or reference

tasks.task: Operate a pneumatic planter to plant seeds
subtasks: Assemble the pneumatic planter by attaching the air chambers and seed tubes
Calibration the planter by setting seed metering and depth control
Check the adjustment of the seed tubes to ensure they are level and correct orientation
Place the planter on the toolbar and secure all connections
Check the air pressure in each air chamber and adjust as necessary
Start the planter and check seed movement, making corrections if necessary
Monitor actual planting depth and rate while moving the toolbar through the field
Ensure consistent spacing between seed rows by adjusting the sweep openers
Address any clogs or issues in the air supply lines during operation
Clean and maintain the planter after use, noting any necessary repairs

tasks.task: Harvest corn using a combine harvester
subtasks: Position the combine harvester at the start of the corn field
Engage the header to cut the corn stalks, adjusting for wind conditions
Move the combine through the field at a steady speed, maintaining proper head speed
Check the corn ears to determine if they are sufficiently dry
Stereo Oscillograms the separator to the appropriate speed for optimal grain separation
Monitor the combine's operational efficiency and check for any spills or losses
Verify the clean grain box is functioning properly, separating grain from chaff
Inspect the grain grades and adjust the auger or elevator as necessary
Communicate with team members on the pickup platform to ensure efficiency
Weigh the grain to monitor yield and adjust operations as needed
Store the harvested corn in bins or silos according to quality and variety

tasks.task: Attend to a grain drill setup for planting oats
subtasks: Choose the appropriate grain drill type (single or twin disc) for the field conditions
Assemble the grain drill by installing the coulters, closing wheels, and pop-ups
Attach and tension the crop cover plates to ensure proper seed placement
Set the seed depth and spacing accurately, using the depth gauge wheels
Fill the seed boxes with oats and check the seed flow regulators
Ensure the opening gauge wheels are properly spaced to cover the drill meters
Test the grain drill by operating it on a short strip of ground to check placement
Adjust the ground speed for efficient seeding and ensure proper coverage
Remove the grain drill and store components when done

tasks.task: Cross connect a three-point hitch for lowering a stubble shredder
subtasks: Identify the three-point hitch points on the tractor and the shredder
Position the shredder close to the tractor for easy connection
Lift the rear section of the shredder using the three-point hitch lift
Engage the mid-rear lift and lower the shredder into position
Align the tongue or drawbar of the shredder with the tractor three-point hitch
Secure the connection with the bolts or clamps, ensuring tightness
Adjust the height of the shredder for optimal operation
Engage the hydraulic elevators to test lifting and lowering
Verify that the attachment is stable before operation

tasks.task: Install the furrow endings on a planter unit
subtasks: Examine the planter to determine the correct end sections for the row units
Lift the row units to position the furrow ending components
Insert the closing wheels into the furrow, ensuring they are in the correct position
Secure the closing wheels with the retainers or clamps
Adjust the closing wheel pressure to appropriately seal the furrow
Check the depth of the closing wheels to prevent seed placement in wet soil
After assembly, test the operation by simulating planting

tasks.task: Adjust the closing wheel pressure for a rice planter
subtasks: Locate the adjusting mechanisms on the closing wheels of the planter
Loosen any locking nuts or adjusters to allow wheel movement
Place a scale or weight on test points to simulate seed load
Either manually cradle the closing wheels or adjust the springs to maintain desired pressure
Confirm the correct pressure is set by observing the depth the wheel penetrates the soil
Repeat for other row units to ensure consistency
Secure the adjusting mechanisms and test operation in a field

tasks.task: Perform operational functions on a seed drill
subtasks: Start the seed drill and check all moving parts for proper operation
Adjust the seed drop meters to ensure consistent and accurate seed placement
Check the seed tubes for any obstructions or wear that could affect seed flow
Verify the clarity of the furrow by adjusting the coulter blades if necessary
Monitor the seed depth and spacing as the drill moves through the ground
Check for uneven furrows, which may affect seed placement
Apply any necessary fertilizer or pesticide during drilling using the drill's integrated applicators
Monitor the activity of the down-pressure rollers or press wheels to gauge seed coverage
Clean and lubricate the drill components after use

tasks.task: Prepare a grain wagon for transporting wheat
subtasks: Secure the wagon's sides and back panels to prevent grain spillage
Check the load and balance the weight of the grain in the wagon
Cover the wagon with a tarp or canvas to protect the grain from weather
Fasten the tarp down with ropes or tension straps
Attach the wagon's hitch to the tractor and check for proper connection
Load the grain into the wagon through the back gate or side doors
Close and lock the wagon doors or gates
Weigh the grain load to ensure it does not exceed safe transport limits

tasks.task: Verify a drip distributor's operation on a sugarcane harvester
subtasks: Start the harvester and monitor the drip rate of the distributor over sugarcane stalks
Check for any leaks or spray misalignment in the distributor's nozzles
Adjust the distributor's height or angle to achieve proper coverage
Analyze the sugarcane moisture content affected by the drip water
Check the residue left on the field after harvesting; confirm that the distributor is not causing clumps

tasks.task: Open and close a header on a combine harvester
subtasks: Detach the header from the combine by locking the front wheels, lifting the header, and disconnecting any hydraulics
Lower the header and roll it to the storage location, ensuring it is stable
Attach the header to the header rack, lock it in place, and connect the hydraulics and electricals
Start the combine and manually operate the header to ensure it is functioning correctly
Adjust the cutter bar height if needed before full operation

tasks.task: Adjust a hydraulic stacker's conveyor belt for silage loading
subtasks: Locate the hydraulic controls for raising and lowering the conveyor belt
Determine the appropriate height for the belt to match the silage pit or container
Monitor grain flow onto the conveyor and adjust the belt's speed for efficiency
Maintain the alignment of the conveyor belt to prevent grain from bouncing off
Test the conveyor's braking systems to ensure safety when stopping
Clean the belt rollers and adjust tension as needed between uses

tasks.task: Cultivate a field with a chisel plow
subtasks: Connect the chisel plow to the rear three-point hitch of a tractor
Set the depth of the chisel points based on the intended soil tillage
Test the plow's operation by pushing it through a small section of ground
Adjust the plow's position and angles for effective penetration
Monitor the soil disturbance and adjust as necessary during operation
Check for soil paneled or when the chisel plow breaks clods effectively, to control weed growth
Run the operation at a balanced and consistent speed

tasks.task: Engage a three-point hitch-mounted tillage tool
subtasks: Identify the correct three-point hitch points on the tractor and tool
Line up the hitch pin with the attachment point and lower the tool into position
Connect the hydraulic hoses and electrical connections to the tool
Perform a safety check by operating the tool in an empty field first
Raise the hitch to the desired height and lock it in place
Disconnect the tool if an adjustment is necessary during use

tasks.task: Remove a wheel from a combine harvester
subtasks: Locate the correct wheel for replacement (front, rear, or side)
Apply the combine's power take-off (PTO) safety lock if necessary
Lower the combine to the ground to access the wheel
Loosen the retaining nuts or bolts on the wheel hub
Carefully remove the wheel, being cautious not to pinch hoses or cables
Inspect the wheel for wear or damage and replace if necessary
Apply a new retaining nut and retighten to manufacturer specifications
Repeat for any other wheels needing replacement
